page.title: 19M.A.L.F. Pitt-Rivers Esq. i
page.content: {Mr Pitt-Rivers}lives in the beaut- iful{King John's house where King John {himself probably stayed when hunting {in Cranborne Chase.}The house is a mixture of{Tudor}outside built around the remains of a{stone medieval manor. His estate is of{4,000 acres}of which{2,500}is forest. He used to have {50 men}working on it but now contract- ors do the jobs as the labour costs were too high. His main interests are{conservat- {ion, breeding}and{judging Arab horses and{collecting works of art from the {Far East. l5 years ago}he formed a group called the{'Cranborne Chase {Conservation Society'.}As a result the Chase was made{'an area of outstanding {natural beauty'.}Later the area was made a{'site of special scientific {interest'. { Continued on page 20
